intro: Sprengelia setifolia, commonly known as the slender-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Sprengelia setifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
